$interpreted: Forgetful Tom: Officer Jerome, please wait for me~~
Forgetful Tom: I'm so lucky! When I found out I was assigned to General Feiz's ranks, I was super nervous at first, since I heard that she's really strict~
Forgetful Tom: Didn't know that officer is assigned here as well. I feel much more at ease with you around.
Jerome: Nothing wrong with a general being strict. That way, she won't drink during working hours and be habitually late.
Forgetful Tom: Officer...you aren't talking about General Lucien, are you?
Jerome: ......
Jerome: It's almost time. We're going to be late if we don't report to the army now.
Feiz: Arrived just on time. You people are this close to being late.
Forgetful Tom: General Feiz, I am...
Feiz: I know who you are. You're assigned to the 3rd infantry unit. Fall in the ranks now. Don't let everyone wait for just you.
Feiz: As with you, you should be my new officer, right?
Jerome: Yes, ma'am. I am Jerome Muca.
Late Peter: I'm here! I'm here!
Late Peter: General Feiz, apologies. My elderly mother fell down and broke her bones. I had to get her to the doctor first. That's why I was late...
Feiz: It's alright. You don't have to apologize to me.
Late Peter: Thank you, general. I will not forget your kindness.

Feiz: Doesn't matter if you forget either. I have no intention to make an exception. You are relieved of your duties starting today.
Therefore, you don't need to apologize.
Late Peter: No, I need a job! General, my mother's medical expenses——
Feiz: That's your personal responsibility. It has nothing to do with the army. One must separate the public issues from the private ones.
Jerome: General Feiz, I would consider this case an accident. It is nothing unforgivable. We should address this as a special case.
Feiz: The army's rules are absolute. Violations should not be tolerated. If everyone gets to be late for personal issues, the war is lost before it even starts!
Jerome: Then a warning should suffice. There is no need to fire someone for such minor violations.
Feiz: No wonder you have such absurd ideas.
Feiz: That Fredrica woman has been like this since her student days. She was an arrogant show-off, and she constantly ignored the school's rules.
Jerome: General Feiz, are you friends with General Lucien?
Feiz: Friends? With her? Are you trying to insult me?
Feiz: I heard that her army is slack and poorly disciplined. I advise you not to bring those bad habits to my army.
Jerome: I'm not...
Feiz: Enough talking. You've wasted too much of my time already.
Feiz: You, leave. I will not make an exception for you.
Late Peter: ....Yes.
Feiz: Everyone, listen! On my command, we will embark for Jersey under the orders of Queen Angelia!!
Late Peter: This money...
Jerome: Cover your mother's medical expenses with it first. You can pay me back after you find a job.
Forgetful Tom: Didn't expect Queen Angelia to assign two generals simultaneously to take charge of Jersey together.
Forgetful Tom: Looks like she doesn't really trust General Lucien...
Jerome: ...It could also just be because this area is notorious for bandit problems. Heard many reports about supply transports being robbed here.
Jerome: The queen is simply worried about a manpower shortage, that's why she made such an arrangement.
Forgetful Tom: If that's the case, officer Jerome,  wouldn't it be awkward for you when you meet your ex-girlfriend at work?
Jerome: General Lucien and I did not have that kind of relationship.
Scout: Reporting to officer Jerome, your judgment is on point. We've discovered bandit activity right down the road.
Jerome: Understood. We cannot let them continue assaulting the food transports.
Jerome: Everyone, at my signal, eliminate the bandits!
Bandit: Darn it! Got busted by the Kingdom Army! Everybody, RUN! Someone go tell the Boss to get the hell out here!
Jerome: You are not going anywhere! Everyone, formation 4. We must stop them here no matter what!
Jerome: Didn't see anyone who seems like a leader...
Scout: Officer, it appears that another group of bandits has shown themselves right ahead.
Jerome: Very well. Men! For the honor of the Kingdom Army, we shall not let a single one of them escape!
